title: How to Make Sloppy Joes

steps.headline: Cook the meat in a large saucepan over medium heat.
steps.description: Make sure all the meat is cooked thoroughly. Drain all the grease and fat out from the pan.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients to the pan.
Mix everything together while getting the mixture to a boil.
Turn down the heat to a simmer.
steps.description: Cover and allow to simmer for at least 10 minutes; if you want the mixture to be drier, you can continue for about 30 to 40 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the pan from the heat.
steps.description: Fold the mixture a few times so the simmered ingredients aren't sitting in one part of the pan.

steps.headline: Toast the hamburger buns.
steps.description: Toasting the bread will give it that crispy taste as you sink your teeth into the sandwich.

steps.headline: Scoop a generous amount of the sloppy joe mixture on each of the bottom hamburger buns.
steps.description: Gently lay the top hamburger bun on top of the mixture.
